column4: Broadcaster CME completes sale of preferred stock to Time Warner
column5: PRAGUE Central European Media Enterprises (CME)   has completed the sale of 200 000 shares of new convertible class B preferred stock for $200 million to shareholder Time Warner  as part of a plan to reduce debt.

column4: REFILE-Etisalat  Turkcell  others eye Dubai's Tunisie Telecom stake
column5: TUNIS  June 26 Thirteen companies including Abu Dhabi-based Etisalat and Turkey's Turkcell  have expressed interest in buying Dubai Holding's 35 percent stake in Tunisie Telecom  a government official said on Wednesday.

column4: Wal-Mart India head leaves as store rollout struggles
column5: MUMBAI Wal-Mart Stores Inc   hit by a series of setbacks in its efforts to crack the promising but restrictive India market  said its country head had left the company.

column4: Wal-Mart names interim head for India business
column5: MUMBAI Wal-Mart Stores Inc   which has spent years trying to crack the long-restricted India market  said on Wednesday its country head had left the company and named an interim replacement.
